ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Meniere's Disease
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: 10-year history of fluctuating hearing (now stabilized), roaring tinnitus, and history of vertigo.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Binaural Interference
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports distortion in the right ear; aided testing shows bilateral performance (50%) is poorer than left monaural performance (66%).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Retrocochlear Pathology
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant asymmetry in word recognition scores (Right 50%, Left 66%) despite symmetric thresholds requires exclusion of retrocochlear lesions.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds and configuration.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To investigate reported distortion and verify benefit of amplification configurations.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results reveal bilateral symmetrical moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss with a flat configuration. Despite symmetric thresholds, word recognition scores are asymmetric (poorer in the right ear). Middle ear function is normal, but acoustic reflexes are absent bilaterally.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss (~60-70 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs agree with PTAs (R 75 dB, L 65 dB). WRS is asymmetric: Right 50%, Left 66% at 85 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Type A bilaterally; normal middle ear pressure and compliance.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Aided testing confirms binaural interference. The patient performs worse with bilateral amplification (50%) compared to the left hearing aid alone (66%), consistent with reports of distortion in the right ear.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise / Aided Word Recognition
tests.result_summary: Left monaural aided: 66%; Right monaural aided: 40%; Bilateral aided: 50%. Demonstrates binaural interference.

proposed_items: Fit BiCROS hearing aid system (Transmitter on Right, Receiver/Aid on Left)
Verify fitting with Electroacoustic Analysis (Test Box) and Real Ear Measures (REM)
Provide remote microphone for speech understanding in noise
Include tinnitus program (noise generator) in the hearing aid settings
counseling_actions: Counsel on realistic expectations regarding speech understanding due to poor word recognition scores
Explain the concept of binaural interference and why the right hearing aid was causing difficulty
Explain the benefits of the BiCROS system for sound awareness without amplifying distortion
Discuss the recommendation for medical referral to rule out causes of asymmetry

escalation.rationale_short: To rule out retrocochlear pathology (e.g., acoustic neuroma) or other causes for the asymmetry in speech recognition despite symmetric thresholds.

follow_up_plan.objective: Fit and verify the BiCROS system and monitor patient satisfaction.

expected_outcome: Test Box Verification: Left receiver hearing aid matched targets at 50, 65, and 75 dB SPL; transmitter verified to transmit signals to the receiver.
Real Ear Measures (REM): Left receiver matched NAL-NL2 targets; transmitter activation eliminated the head shadow effect (response at 90 degrees right matched 90 degrees left).
Patient reported significantly less distortion and improved listening effort with the BiCROS system.
Patient was very pleased with the left BiCROS system.
